intro: Brachystelma tanzaniensis, commonly known as the Tanzanian stone orchid, is a succulent plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, ribbed stems. It produces pale yellow to orange flowers during the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and succulent enthusiasts.
